title: Make Brand Good
subtitle: How to Compress Worlds Into Symbols That Stick

headline: Compression: Say More With Less
body: Design is compression. Meaning under pressure.
A brand is a zip file — a tiny package that holds emotion, history, and intent.
Every pixel, color, and word should carry its weight. No passengers.

image.alt: visual metaphor for compression in design

headline: If You Can Name It, You Can Tame It
body: Language is the original interface. Naming is power.
The moment you name your aesthetic, your tone, or your vibe, you gain control over it.
Wittgenstein said: *"The limits of my language mean the limits of my world."*

image.alt: typographic exploration of naming and framing

headline: Interface: Everything Between You and the World
body: Every interaction — a website, a logo, a tone of voice — is an interface.
Good interfaces reduce friction. Every extra click or doubt loses attention.
Design like you respect people's time. Make it feel inevitable.

image.alt: hand reaching toward abstract interface elements

headline: Curate to create
body: You don't need to invent. You need to *choose* well.
Curation is the art of reduction — selecting what resonates and rejecting the noise.
Aesthetic coherence comes from taste, not abundance.

image.alt: moodboard or collage of curated design elements

headline: “The way you do one thing is the way you do everything.”
body: Design, tone, timing — they’re all the same signal, refracted.

headline: Narrative: The Ultimate Compression
body: Stories are the original data format.
A logo, a name, a font — they all tell a story faster than words can.
The strongest brands are myths you can summarize in a sentence.

image.alt: Oasis logo juxtaposed with crowd energy

headline: Visual Myths in Action
body: Each of these logos compresses a universe — class, rebellion, joy, belonging.

headline: Coherence Builds Trust
body: Consistency creates familiarity. Familiarity breeds trust.
Stick with your palette, your tone, your logo. Time adds luster.
If you change too much, you reset your story. Pick a lane and grow in it.

headline: Friction Kills Frequency
body: Every unnecessary choice or delay breaks the rhythm of engagement.
Reduce the cognitive load. Make it easy to understand, share, and love.
The best design feels invisible until it's gone.

image.alt: diagram of user drop-off after clicks

headline: “Authenticity is a system.”
body: You earn it through consistency, taste, and repetition — not slogans.

headline: Your First 0.3 Seconds
body: People decide if they vibe with you in 0.3 seconds.
Design for that gut instinct — color, layout, rhythm, tone.
Your frequency should be instantly readable, like a song you recognize in one note.

image.alt: faces reacting instantly to visual identity

headline: Authenticity Prints Rough
body: Perfect is suspicious. Real is trustworthy.
Riso prints, xerox zines, and DIY posters feel alive because they have texture — randomness that signals honesty.
Limitations give character. Two inks can say more than a gradient ever will.

headline: Bone Soup: Consistency Through Chaos
body: Scrappy logos, recycled paper, and stamped mail-outs. Every imperfection tells the same story: human, local, and loud.

headline: The Anti-Brand Brand
body: The best rebellion is coherence with irony.
Liquid Death, Palace, 100 Gecs — they glitch the system by playing its game too well.
Subversion works when it's fluent in the language it mocks.

image.alt: Liquid Death logo on black can

headline: Color = Compressed Emotion
body: Pick three. One base, one contrast, one accent. The 60-30-10 rule keeps chaos elegant.

pillars.title: Base (60%)
pillars.text: Sets the mood. Often neutral or brand-defining.

pillars.title: Contrast (30%)
pillars.text: Adds tension and energy.

pillars.title: Accent (10%)
pillars.text: The emotional spark — the juice.

pillars.title: Hack
pillars.text: Color is speed. People feel before they think.

headline: Typography = Compressed Voice
body: You already know how fonts feel — trust that instinct.
The medium *is* the message. Don't let the wrong font betray your intent.
Explore quality free fonts at [open-foundry.com](https://open-foundry.com/fonts)

headline: Shape = Compressed Psychology
body: Circles feel safe. Squares feel stable. Triangles feel sharp and active.
Even before language, your brain reads shapes as emotional cues.
Designers are behavioral engineers — you're scripting comfort or tension.

image.alt: diagram of circle square triangle psychology

headline: Semiotics: Symbols Carry Worlds
body: Symbols are cultural shortcuts. They inherit meaning through history and use. Flip a triangle and you can change its entire moral resonance. The 'Silence = Death' poster's red triangle now means Palestinian resistance. One rotation, new world.

image.alt: Red triangle poster comparison up vs down

headline: Steal, Remix, Repeat
body: Symbols are open source. Ownership is consistency.
Use them carefully — remix, don't parody. Every iteration redefines the language.
Meaning is a frequency. Tune it until it resonates with your people.

image.alt: collage of cultural symbols and remixes

headline: “Ugly is the new honesty.”
body: When everything’s polished, roughness reads as truth. Use it with intent.

headline: Follow Your Nose
body: You already know what feels right — you've been trained by culture since birth.
Trust your vibe. Curate what resonates and compress it into your visual language.
Everything else is noise.

title: Systems & Synthesis
subtitle: Naming, Rhythm, and the Architecture of Consistency

image.alt: Mac DeMarco portrait with warm tones

headline: Name It to Frame It (Again)
body: Naming isn't a label — it's a handle for meaning.
Once you name your system, you can navigate it.
'Pastel Punk Neo-Brutalism' isn't a joke; it's a compass.

image.alt: naming notebook sketches and sticky notes

headline: Build Systems, Not One-Offs
body: Every poster, logo, or layout should live in the same ecosystem.
Lock your palette, type, and spacing — make templates that scale.
If you do it once, do it twice. Repetition builds trust.

image.alt: repeating poster grid with consistent layout

headline: Teenage Engineering: Elegance Through Play
body: Their site (teenage.engineering) is a masterclass in restraint — three colors, one typeface, endless charm.
The OP-1 is a toy and a tool. Nostalgic, futuristic, simple, and human.
Playfulness *is* precision when it's intentional.

headline: The Moodboard as Operating System
body: Pinterest is free curation school. Your boards are data sets.
Collect, label, remix — each board becomes a prototype of taste.
Curation isn’t procrastination; it’s preprocessing.

headline: Your Pack: A Design Survival Kit
body: Everything else is flavor. Keep the pack light so you can move fast.

pillars.title: Colors
pillars.text: 3–4 tones that define emotion.

pillars.title: Fonts
pillars.text: 2 families that define voice.

pillars.title: Shapes
pillars.text: 1–2 recurring motifs that define form.

pillars.title: Textures
pillars.text: Add imperfection to make it human.

headline: Simplicity Is Compression
body: Remove until what’s left still works and still feels.
Less isn’t minimalism — it’s efficiency of signal.
Elegance is when nothing is wasted, not when everything is white.

headline: "Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication."
body: — Leonardo da Vinci

headline: Frequency Over Reach
body: You don’t need everyone — just the right ones.
Your brand is a broadcast. Keep your signal clear and consistent.
Repetition isn’t boring when it’s rhythmic.

image.alt: radio waves or sound frequency visualization

headline: The Pareto Principle of Design
body: 80% of perception comes from 20% of elements.
Focus on the heavy hitters: typography, color, composition.
Perfecting minor details before core tone is ego, not craft.

headline: Juicy. Sticky. Fresh.
body: My design language in three words: tactile, memorable, alive.
Juicy: squishy, fun, touchable.  Sticky: something you want to return to.  Fresh: present and culturally awake.
Compress your vibe into a trinity. That's brand philosophy distilled.

image.alt: colorful tactile UI collage or playful typography
workshop table with laptop and design tools

headline: Systems Thinking = Self Thinking
body: If you design a system, you design yourself a map.
Your color palette, font set, folder structure — all of it is a reflection of your thought process.
Build systems that make future-you’s life easier.

headline: Modularity Is Freedom
body: Modular systems aren't constraints — they're creative trampolines.
A modular logo or layout lets you remix endlessly without breaking tone.
SVGs are forever. Infinite scale, zero loss. Always export your logos as vectors.

image.alt: SVG icons in grid showing scalability

headline: Frame Is Everything
body: Frank Zappa said the frame is the most important part of the art.
It tells the audience *how to look* and *how much to care.*
Design's job is to frame meaning — the font, crop, and border are the handshake.

image.alt: art gallery frames and interface borders

headline: Tyler, the Creator: Evolution Through Design
body: Every era is a palette: 'Igor' (pink experimental), 'Flower Boy' (warmth), 'Call Me If You Get Lost' (passport chic). He designs emotion.

image.alt: Call Me If You Get Lost passport cover

headline: Good Systems Have Rules
body: Every good brand or artist has invisible rules. Make yours explicit.

pillars.title: Naming
pillars.text: Give your patterns names — language creates order.

pillars.title: Limiting
pillars.text: Choose 3–4 visual variables and stay faithful.

pillars.title: Layering
pillars.text: Add nuance through rhythm, not excess.

pillars.title: Reusing
pillars.text: Templates are sacred. Repeat your wins.

headline: Shortcuts = Superpowers
body: There’s no prize for doing it the long way.
Tools like TinyWow, remove.bg, ColorHunt, Coolors, and Figma templates exist so you can focus on the vibe, not the plumbing.
Use free tools. You’re not cheating; you’re compressing workflow.

image.alt: screenshots of online creative tools like Coolors and TinyWow

headline: Compress Your Assets
body: Keep a folder of ready-to-drop elements — logos, fonts, bios, mockups.
Make every file modular and future-proof. Version control = mental clarity.
When your assets are tidy, your mind is free.

image.alt: design assets neatly organized in folders

headline: “Curiosity is your operating system.”
body: Follow your nose. Your taste evolves faster than your tools — let it lead.

headline: Build Once, Reuse Forever
body: Every time you build a deck, layout, or logo, save the skeleton.
Recycling your own systems is how professionals seem effortless.
Set up your creative OS — your pack is your future.

headline: Tools Don’t Make Taste
body: Figma, Photoshop, Procreate — none of them give you a vibe.
Taste is compressed curiosity, curated over time.
Tools are amplifiers. You’re the signal.

image.alt: designer using laptop surrounded by art references

title: Applied Compression
subtitle: Shortcuts, Taste, and the Wisdom of Restraint

image.alt: studio desk with sketchbooks and laptop

headline: “Three colors is harmony. Four colors? Now you’re talking jazz.”
body: Keep it simple. A good palette is like a good chord — tension, release, rhythm.

headline: Loaded Symbols Carry Luggage
body: Every icon has history. Hearts, eyes, crosses, flames — they arrive pre-charged.
If you use a loaded symbol, be intentional. Don’t let your work say something you didn’t mean.
A red heart says love. A green one says, ‘I’m not sure.’

image.alt: grid of icons and emojis showing subtle tone shifts

headline: Color Is Frequency
body: Colors are emotional notes. You're composing a feeling.
Hue = pitch. Saturation = volume. Value = tempo.
Design your vibe like you'd mix a song — with balance and groove.

headline: Shortcuts You Can Trust
body: Real tools. No Canva. No excuses.

pillars.title: Color
pillars.text: [ColorHunt.co](https://colorhunt.co) / [Colorize.design](https://colorize.design) / [Colormind.io](https://colormind.io)

pillars.title: Fonts
pillars.text: [Fontshare.com](https://www.fontshare.com) / [Fonts In Use](https://fontsinuse.com) / [Fontspring Matcherator](https://www.fontspring.com/matcherator)

pillars.title: Assets
pillars.text: [TinyWow.com](https://tinywow.com) / [Remove.bg](https://remove.bg) / [Upscayl.org](https://upscayl.org)

pillars.title: Inspo & Layout
pillars.text: [Mobbin.com](https://mobbin.com) / [PageFlows.com](https://pageflows.com) / [Godly.website](https://godly.website)

headline: Taste Is a Muscle
body: You don’t find taste — you train it.
Scroll consciously. Save what moves you. Question what doesn’t.
The algorithm is a mirror. Teach it your frequency.

headline: Framing Is Everything
body: Zappa said the frame tells people how to value the art.
The font on a book cover is the handshake before the story.
Frame your work like it deserves to be believed.

headline: “Simplicity isn’t less. It’s focus.”
body: The trick isn’t taking things away — it’s leaving only what sings.

headline: Your Creative OS
body: Your pack, your palette, your references — that’s your operating system.
When it’s solid, new work builds itself.
Compression is freedom. You make space for flow.

image.alt: neatly organized creative folders labeled colors_fonts_icons

headline: Wisdom for Builders
body: Don’t chase aesthetics; chase coherence.
Restraint is charisma.
Everything good ages well because it knows what it is.

image.alt: simple iconic logos that have endured

headline: “Follow your curiosity. It’s the only reliable compass.”
body: Every system, every logo, every frame started as someone following a hunch.

title: Permission & Subversion
subtitle: Being the Glitch and Building Anyway

image.alt: glitch art collage with bright tones
vintage DIY zine covers and punk posters

headline: “If you can’t join the system, jam it.”
body: Subversion isn’t chaos — it’s clarity through contradiction.

headline: You Are the Glitch
body: The system wants sameness. Your weirdness is the signal that breaks through.
Every artist, coder, and misfit who ever mattered started as an error message.
Be the glitch. It’s the only part the algorithm can’t predict.

headline: Steal Boldly, Remix Shamelessly
body: Good artists borrow. Great artists steal and rename the folder.
The KLF literally burned a million pounds — you can at least remix a moodboard.
Ownership is repetition. Say it often enough and it becomes yours.

image.alt: collage of remixed cultural images and zine snippets

headline: Permission Granted
body: Nobody is coming to crown you with legitimacy.
You give yourself permission — to start, to ask, to fail, to retry.
Confidence is just self-issued authority repeated over time.

headline: “The moment you stop asking if you’re allowed, you start making art.”
body: Ask forgiveness from no one — except maybe your color palette.

headline: Trust Your Taste
body: Taste is intuition trained by time.
If it feels right, it probably is — the hard part is letting yourself believe that.
Doubt is part of the rhythm; it keeps the groove honest.

image.alt: close-up of mixing console and hands adjusting faders

headline: Seek, Ask, Search
body: Every answer is already somewhere — your job is to find the right question.
Google is the new oracle, but discernment is your filter.
Don’t wait for clarity — generate it through curiosity.

image.alt: search bar overlay on abstract pattern

headline: Build, Break, Repeat
body: Every creative system has to collapse a few times before it stabilizes.
Iteration is evolution. Failure is just an unoptimized prototype.
The Church of the SubGenius would call that Slack.

image.alt: recycled design drafts layered over each other

headline: “Reality is the ultimate remix.”
body: Everything you make is built from everything you’ve loved.

headline: Final Thought: The Glitch Is the Grace
body: Perfection is sterile. Glitches prove something’s alive.
Compression, curation, narrative — all just ways of shaping noise into meaning.
You are the interface. Stay curious. Stay messy. Stay human.

headline: “Bless your mess.”
body: Everything worth doing starts as noise.
The universe runs on accidents, noodles, and good timing.
Thanks for listening. Go make something weird.

image.alt: risograph ghost or SubGenius-style smiling face

title: The Cheat Codes
subtitle: Compressed Rules, Useful Tools, and Sacred Shortcuts

image.alt: arcade start screen with glitch overlay

headline: Compression in Numbers
body: Ratios are poetry disguised as math. They’re shortcuts to harmony.

pillars.title: 60/30/10 Rule
pillars.text: Main tone, secondary support, accent spark. Works for color, layout, and sound.

pillars.title: 80/20 Rule
pillars.text: Eighty percent of the impact comes from twenty percent of the elements. Find your heavy hitters.

pillars.title: Rule of Thirds
pillars.text: Balance your grid by dividing your frame into threes — simplicity through geometry.

pillars.title: Golden Ratio (1.618)
pillars.text: Use sparingly; it’s sacred math, not a religion. Trust your eye over your ruler.

headline: Type Is Voice
body: Typography is music for people who read with their eyes.

pillars.title: Pair with Purpose
pillars.text: One loud font, one calm font. Let them play call and response.

pillars.title: Hierarchy Heals
pillars.text: Contrast makes meaning. Don’t whisper what should shout.

pillars.title: Type as Texture
pillars.text: Sometimes legibility is overrated. Feeling > reading.

pillars.title: Never Stretch Type
pillars.text: You’re not God. Don’t warp Helvetica.

headline: Grids Keep You Honest
body: Grids aren’t prisons — they’re trampolines.

pillars.title: Respect Margins
pillars.text: Whitespace is oxygen. If you’re suffocating, pull back.

pillars.title: Align to Rhythm
pillars.text: Every good layout has a beat. Even punk posters.

pillars.title: One Weird Element
pillars.text: Break your grid once to prove you built it.

pillars.title: Symmetry Is Optional
pillars.text: Tension is what keeps the eye awake.

headline: Emotional Math
body: Color is emotion translated into math.

pillars.title: Hue = Personality
pillars.text: Cool = distance, Warm = closeness. Mix to taste.

pillars.title: Saturation = Energy
pillars.text: Dial down to calm, push up to shout.

pillars.title: Value = Depth
pillars.text: Dark recedes, light advances. Use that tension.

pillars.title: Palette = Band
pillars.text: If one tone plays jazz, kick it from the lineup.

headline: Unwritten But Universal
body: Every design problem is just a confidence problem wearing different pants.

pillars.title: Law of Intention
pillars.text: If you don’t define your vibe, someone else will.

pillars.title: Law of Economy
pillars.text: Spend effort where it pays dividends — aesthetics that scale.

pillars.title: Law of Play
pillars.text: If it’s not fun, the audience can tell.

pillars.title: Law of Persistence
pillars.text: Everything great was embarrassing halfway through.

headline: Underground Tools & Free Resources
body: Free doesn’t mean cheap. It means frictionless curiosity.

pillars.title: Color & Texture
pillars.text: [Lospec Palette List](https://lospec.com/palette-list) / [Khroma.co](https://khroma.co) / [Cool Backgrounds](https://coolbackgrounds.io)

pillars.title: Fonts & Type
pillars.text: [Velvetyne.fr](https://velvetyne.fr) / [Fontshare](https://fontshare.com) / [FutureFonts.xyz](https://www.futurefonts.xyz)

pillars.title: Inspiration
pillars.text: [Hoverstat.es](https://hoverstat.es) / [BrutalistWebsites.com](https://brutalistwebsites.com) / [Design Museum Everywhere](https://designmuseumeverywhere.org)

pillars.title: Utility & Weirdness
pillars.text: [TinyWow.com](https://tinywow.com) / [Haikei.app](https://haikei.app) / [BGJar.com](https://bgjar.com)

headline: Fuel for Designers, Builders, and Mischief Makers
body: Steal their methods, not their mystique.

pillars.title: Design & Thought
pillars.text: John Maeda – *Laws of Simplicity* / Susan Kare – *Icons & Symbols* / Ellen Lupton – *Thinking with Type*

pillars.title: Systems & Chaos
pillars.text: Brian Eno – *Oblique Strategies* / Stewart Brand – *How Buildings Learn* / Kevin Kelly – *What Technology Wants*

pillars.title: Subversion & Spirit
pillars.text: The KLF – *The Manual* / Church of the SubGenius – *Book of the SubGenius* / Jenny Odell – *How to Do Nothing*

pillars.title: Culture & Compression
pillars.text: Marshall McLuhan – *The Medium is the Massage* / David Byrne – *How Music Works* / Paul Rand – *Design, Form and Chaos*

headline: Keep the Channel Open
body: The best designers aren’t chasing trends — they’re decoding frequencies.
Every system you build is a prayer to future-you.
Bless your mess, compress your chaos, and keep your interface kind.
